list.title: The Scavenger’s Story
list.notes: Talk to Kaya after reaching the city of Xion.

list.title: Looking at You
list.notes: Talk to Su after reaching the city of Xion.

list.title: First Customer
list.notes: Talk to Kasim. Available after accepting `Urgent Information` Sidequest.

list.notes: Talk to Cyrus inside The Last Cup bar in Xion. Passcode: `θθθθθ`

list.notes: Talk to Lyle inside his shop

list.notes: Talk to Francis at the Library in Xion

list.title: Oblivion
list.notes: Talk to the girl found on the small house located under the bridge at the entrace of Xion.

list.title: Taboo
list.notes: Talk to Luther which is found near the bridge leading to the Wastelands in Xion

list.title: An Unknown Present
list.notes: Encounter Inn just behind Gwen’s Salon.

list.notes: Talk to Enya inside the bar in Xion.

list.title: Encounter
list.notes: Talk to Kaya after completing the Alpha SIgnal main mission. You must also have max affection with Kaya to start the quest.

list.title: An Offer You Can’t Refuse
list.notes: Talk to Roxanne after completing the `Alpha Signal` main mission.

list.title: I Won’t Forget You
list.notes: Talk to Beatrice who is idling by at the cross roads on the bridge leading to xion, the tetrapod, and the road to wastelands.

list.notes: Talk to Mann while on the Presence Chamber. Passcode: `θμκαεγ`

list.title: A United People Cannot be Defeated
list.notes: Interact with the record at the table at the small restaurant in Xion.

list.notes: Talk to Francis at the library in Xion

list.notes: After completing `CNL - Communicate and Link`, return to the Tetrapod. Su and Enya will approach you and initiate the quest.

list.notes: Approach the Scrap Yard and Listen to the Distress Signal

list.title: CnL - Communicate and Link
list.notes: Improve D1G-g2r’s affinity to 2 and listen to his “Fantabolous Theory”.

list.title: Incarceration
list.notes: Talk to Jonny who’s hiding in one of the containers in the Eastern Great Canyon.

nikke-dlc.name: NIKKE - DLC
nikke-dlc.title: Stellar Blade X GODDESS OF VICTORY: NIKKE

list.name: Thornhead
list.notes: Thornheads are not overly intimidating enemies. They can easily be taken down from the front.

list.name: Creeper
list.notes: Creeper swarms usually contain unstable entities. They’ll charge at you and attempt to self-destruct, so stay on your toes.

list.name: Mite
list.notes: Mites are not overly intimidating enemies. However, take care not to let them swarm you.

list.name: Mutated Mite
list.notes: The mutated Mites can explode and spray poison. Deal with them before they detonate.

list.name: Boarlet
list.notes: Boarlets are not overly intimidating enemies. They attack by swinging their tails or by rolling with their spikes out.

list.name: Tentacle
list.notes: Tentacles can’t move and only attack things that are nearby. If you do not wish to deal with them, don’t go near them

list.name: Test Subject
list.notes: Several Naytibas carry these experimental subjects on their backs. Treating them as harmless plastic bags would be a deadly assumption.

list.name: Skulling
list.notes: Skullings are always in search of a stronger body. Subdue them before they can contaminate corpses.

list.name: Lesser Lurker
list.notes: Lesser Lurkers are not overly intimidating enemies. However, don’t let them swarm you.

list.name: Broken Droid
list.notes: When the Droid is destroyed, its torso becomes detached. Subdue the torso to finish it off for good.

list.name: Aid Drone
list.notes: Aid Drones heal enemies in the area. You must deal with them first

list.name: Kokeshi
list.notes: Kokeshi are small, spine-chilling machines, Be careful of theirs self-destruction attacks.

list.name: Beholder
list.notes: Beholders attack by slashing with their bone saw blades. Stay calm and fight back against them.

list.name: Mutated Creeper
list.notes: Mutated Creepers can spin and charge at great speeds. Try not to take a blow to the face.

list.name: Barnacle
list.notes: Barnacles can render all attacks from the front useless when they lift their shell-covered legs. You’ll need a smarter strategy.

list.name: Cricket Slasher
list.notes: Cricket Slashers have two arms and one middle arm, which they swipe like a weapon.

list.name: Guardian
list.notes: Guardians have hard skin, but they are slow and simple. Be careful not to let them capture you in their giant arms, as this would spell danger for you.

list.name: Heavy Guardian
list.notes: Heavy Guardians change with their heavy bodies. Avoid them so you don’t get crushed.

list.name: Hydra
list.notes: Hydras can instantly become invisible. When they become invisible, it will be difficult to avoid their surprise charge attacks.

list.name: Cricket Boomer
list.notes: Cricket Boomers attack by spitting acidic saliva. They explode when they die, so don’t let your guard down.

list.name: Cannon Guardian
list.notes: Cannon Guardians are living cannons. They continuously fire or scatter biological bombs.

list.name: Dozer
list.notes: Dozers are agile creatures. Beware of their different kinds of charging attacks.

list.name: Cricket Butcher
list.notes: Critcket Butchers have not only two, but four lethal arms, which they can use to grab, slice, or stab.

list.name: Mutated Hydra
list.notes: Mutated Hydras can float and attack quickly. You need to find a weak point to hurt them.

list.name: Mutated Boarlet
list.notes: A Mutated Boarlet is much more dangerous than a normal Boarlet. Beware of its rolling charge attack or tail binding attack.

list.name: Hedgeboar
list.notes: Hedgeboars are clumsy, but sturdy. They cannot be stunned by most attacks.

list.name: Waster
list.notes: Wasters fight fiercely with their disfigured bodies. Some of their attacks can be threatening, so stay alert.

list.name: Turret Droid
list.notes: Turret Droids are old, corroded turret robots. Their shells can be destroyed with a sword, but be careful when they begin to shoot beams.

list.name: Guard Turret
list.notes: Guard Turrets find and lock on to their targets to fire poweful beams. Quickly find cover if one locks on to you.

list.name: Old Droid
list.notes: Old Droids are correoded security robots that have fallen into disuse. Their attacks are slow, but they can dash at random so stay vigilant.

list.name: Infector
list.notes: Infectors use their long, mutated arms as weapons. They will try to grab and bite you if they can.

list.name: Defiler
list.notes: Defilers disguise themselves by using the test subjects on their backs. When you approach, they will spring up and lunge at you.

list.name: Mutated Defiler
list.notes: Mutated Defilers hide themselves by using the test subjects on their backs. When you approach, they will spring up and lunge at you.

list.name: Hive
list.notes: The Hive is a living Naytiba nest. It rapidly produces small Naytibas, so you must act quickly.

list.name: Machine Hive
list.notes: Machine Hives are abominable nests of jumbled flesh and machine. They constantly produce contaminated machines, so they must be dealt with swiftly

list.name: Skull Trooper
list.notes: Skull Troopers use hammers as their weapons. Keep your cool when they go into a frenzy and wildly flail their weapon.

list.name: Skull Fighter
list.notes: Skull Fighters use long spears as their weapons. Be careful they will not hesitate to put all their strength behind their strikes.

list.name: Skull Gunner
list.notes: Skull Gunners use contaminated arms as organic guns. Move quickly or reflect their fluids to overpower them.

list.name: Skull Berserker
list.notes: Skull Berserkers tear up pillars and carry them on their shoulders. Watch out for their devastating attacks.

list.name: Lurker
list.notes: Lurkers can burrow into the ground and perform surprise attacks. Agility is key to tkaing them down.

list.name: Lesser Behemoth
list.notes: Lesser Behemoths are similar to Behemoths in many ways. However, they are much weaker, so you have more breathing room.

list.name: Cocoon
list.notes: Cocoon attack by firing corrosive bodily fluids. You must be agile enough to avoid their attacks and defeat them.

list.name: Houndborg
list.notes: Houndborgs are designed to behave like dogs, delivering quick, decisive blows

list.name: Sentryborg
list.notes: Sentryborgs are armed with deadly projectiles. The bullets can be blocked or deflected, but not missiles.

list.name: Droid
list.notes: Droid use wrist blades as a weapon.

list.name: Heavy Droid
list.notes: Heavy Droids use wrist blades and shields as weapons.

list.name: Battle Droid
list.notes: Battle Droids can quickly transition between attack and defense modes. They may retreat or charge suddenly to change the tempo of combat

list.name: Lump
list.notes: Lumps use their giant tentacles as weapons. It would be wise to anticipate the direction and range of their attacks in order to strike back.

list.name: Brute
list.notes: Brutes’ explosive attacks come in a variety of forms, including continuous explosions, shockwaves, and ground blasts. Keep your distance and act fast.

list.name: Abaddon
list.notes: Abaddon has the power to harnesss high-voltage electtricity. Do not get caught up in its lightning strikes.

list.name: Stalker
list.notes: Stalkers’ heads are devastating weapons. You must be agile to avoid getting cut by their bone saw blades.

list.name: Corrupter
list.notes: Corrupters shoot toxins like cannonballs. You need to react accordingly, depending on the size.

list.name: Maelstrom
list.notes: Maelstrom throws explosive test subjects from its head. Be carefule of these living bombs

list.name: Juggernaut
list.notes: Juggernauts are unexpectedly violent and quick, rather than slow and clumsy. Do not take them lightly.

list.name: Behemoth
list.notes: Behemoths are ferocious creatures. They unleash various attacks, dealing an onslaught of blows that can be difficult to deal with straight on.

list.name: Belial
list.notes: Belial has tremendous HP and tenacity. A single fight will most likely not be enough to finish it off.

list.name: Karakuri
list.notes: Karukari are advanced version of Kokeshi. Watch out for attacks from smaller robots

list.name: Democrawler
list.notes: Democrawlers drive up their energy to fire barrages or shoot light beams. Be quick to avoid them

list.name: Gigas
list.notes: Gigas has strong physical strength and great agility. Beware of its continuous and charging attacks.

list.name: Tachy
list.notes: Tachy moves quickly to get tactical advantage. Pay attention to every single one of her movements

list.name: Raven
list.notes: Raven likes to toy with the enemy with deceptive movements. Do not fall for her tricks.

list.name: Demogorgon
list.notes: Destroying the Deomogorgon’s massive body is no easy feat, but focusing on its weakness may make this achievable.

list.name: Unidentified Naytiba
list.notes: The unidentified Naytiba is the embodiment of rage. It delivers brutal attacks fueled by pure, unfiltered emotion.

list.name: Adam
list.notes: There is no known information.

list.name: Adam
list.notes: There is no known information.

list.name: Elder Naytiba
list.notes: There is no known information.

list.name: Providence
list.notes: Tachyon Blades are placed inside of both arms of the Providence, allowing it to slice and destroy virtually anything.
